Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: sam

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Turn on debug logging to print debug message generated by SAM CLI and display timestamps

Arguments.Name: --config-env
Arguments.Description: The environment name specifying the default parameter values in the configuration file to use

Arguments.Name: --config-file
Arguments.Description: The path and file name of the configuration file containing default parameter values to use

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Turn on debug logging to print debug message generated by SAM CLI and display timestamps

Arguments.Name: --no-interactive
Arguments.Description: Disable interactive prompting for init parameters, and fail if any required values are missing

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Architectures your Lambda function will run on

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Template location (git, mercurial, http(s), zip, path)

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Dependency manager for your Lambda runtime

Arguments.Name: -o
Arguments.Description: Where to output the initialized app into

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Name of your project to be generated as a folder

Arguments.Name: --app-template
Arguments.Description: Identifier of the managed application template you want to use

Arguments.Name: --no-input
Arguments.Description: Disable Cookiecutter prompting and accept default values defined template config

Arguments.Name: --extra-context
Arguments.Description: Override any custom parameters in the template's cookiecutter.json configuration

Arguments.Name: --docker-network
Arguments.Description: Specifies the name or id of an existing docker network to lambda docker containers should connect to, along with the default bridge network. If not specified, the Lambda containers will only connect to the default bridge docker network.

Arguments.Name: --parameter-overrides
Arguments.Description: A string that contains AWS CloudFormation parameter overrides encoded as key=value pairs

Arguments.Name: --profile
Arguments.Description: Select a specific profile from your credential file to get AWS credentials

Arguments.Name: --region
Arguments.Description: Set the AWS Region of the service

Arguments.Name: --skip-pull-image
Arguments.Description: Specify whether CLI should skip pulling down the latest Docker image for Lambda runtime

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: If your functions depend on packages that have natively compiled dependencies, use this flag to build your function inside an AWS Lambda-like Docker container

Arguments.Name: -e
Arguments.Description: Input environment variables through command line to pass into build containers, you can either input function specific format (FuncName.VarName=Value) or global format (VarName=Value)

Arguments.Name: -ef
Arguments.Description: Path to environment variable json file (e.g., env_vars.json) to pass into build containers

Arguments.Name: -b
Arguments.Description: Path to a folder where the built artifacts will be stored

Arguments.Name: -cd
Arguments.Description: The folder where the cached artifacts are stored with `--cached` is specified

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Resolve relative paths to function's source code with respect to this folder

Arguments.Name: -m
Arguments.Description: Path to a custom dependency manifest to use instead of the default one

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Enable cached builds. Use this flag to reuse build artifacts that have not changed from previous builds

Arguments.Name: local
Arguments.Description: Run your Serverless application locally for quick development & testing

Arguments.Name: generate-event
Arguments.Description: You can use this command to generate sample payloads from different event sources such as S3, API Gateway, and SNS

Arguments.Name: invoke
Arguments.Description: Invokes a local Lambda function once

Arguments.Description: The environment name specifying the default parameter values in the configuration file to use

Arguments.Name: --config-file
Arguments.Description: The path and file name of the configuration file containing default parameter values to use

Arguments.Name: --container-env-vars
Arguments.Description: JSON file containing environment variables to be set within the container environment

Arguments.Name: --container-host-interface
Arguments.Description: IP address of the host network interface that container ports should bind to. Use 0.0.0.0 to bind to all interfaces

Arguments.Description: Host of locally emulated Lambda container

Arguments.Description: Additional arguments to be passed to the debugger

Arguments.Description: Specifies the name or id of an existing docker network to lambda docker containers should connect to, along with the default bridge network. If not specified, the Lambda containers will only connect to the default bridge docker network.

Arguments.Description: Location basedir where the SAM file exists

Arguments.Description: JSON file containing values for Lambda function environment variables

Arguments.Name: --force-upload
Arguments.Description: Indicates whether to override existing files in the S3 bucket. Specify this flag to upload artifacts even if they match existing artifacts in the S3 bucket

Arguments.Name: --image-repositories
Arguments.Description: Specify mapping of Function Logical ID to ECR Repo uri

Arguments.Name: --image-repository
Arguments.Description: ECR repo uri where this command uploads the image artifacts that are referenced in your template

Arguments.Name: --kms-key-id
Arguments.Description: The ID of an AWS KMS key that the command uses to encrypt artifacts that are at rest in the S3 bucket

Arguments.Name: --metadata
Arguments.Description: A map of metadata to attach to ALL the artifacts that are referenced in your template

Arguments.Name: --no-progressbar
Arguments.Description: Does not showcase a progress bar when uploading artifacts to s3

Arguments.Name: --profile
Arguments.Description: Select a specific profile from your credential file to get AWS credentials

Arguments.Name: --region
Arguments.Description: Set the AWS Region of the service

Arguments.Name: --resolve-s3
Arguments.Description: Automatically resolve s3 bucket for non-guided deployments. Enabling this option will also create a managed default s3 bucket for you

Arguments.Name: --s3-bucket
Arguments.Description: The name of the S3 bucket where this command uploads the artifacts that are referenced in your template

Arguments.Name: --s3-prefix
Arguments.Description: A prefix name that the command adds to the artifacts name when it uploads them to the S3 bucket

Arguments.Name: --signing-profiles
Arguments.Description: A string that contains Code Sign configuration parameters

Arguments.Name: --use-json
Arguments.Description: Indicates whether to use JSON as the format for the output AWS CloudFormation template. YAML is used by default

Arguments.Name: --output-template-file
Arguments.Description: The path to the file where the command writes the output AWS CloudFormation template. If unspecified, the command writes the template to the standard output
